XI.i.2.C.3.a
.
Circumstances Under Which It Is Appropriate to Deny a Claim Without Undertaking Development
Deny a claim for survivors benefits without undertaking development to establish a presumption of death if VA would be unable to pay the claimed benefit due to, for example,
a legal bar, or
an unfavorable rating decision.
Important
:  Include the following statement in the corresponding decision notice (with any appropriate modification): “
This denial of your claim does not imply that the Veteran’s death has been established or can be presumed on the basis of the evidence available.
”
title: M21-1, Part XI, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section C  - Presumption of Death
citation: Part XI, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section C
